Package emissary.server.mvc.adapters

Class DirectoryAdapter

java.lang.Object
emissary.client.EmissaryClient
emissary.server.mvc.adapters.DirectoryAdapter
public class DirectoryAdapter extends EmissaryClient
Stuff for adapting the Directory calls to HTTP All the outbound methods supply the TARGET_DIRECTORY parameter that matches the machine/port they are going to. This really only required in testing scenarios but is so helpful that it seems worth the work.

A few of the outbound methods have no corresponding inbound methods because their answer is supplied by a jsp/worker combination without any need to call into the directory on the remote side.

  • Method Details

    • configure

      protected static void configure()

    • outboundAddPlaces

      public EmissaryResponse outboundAddPlaces(String parentDirectory, List<DirectoryEntry> entryList, boolean propagating)
      Handle the packaging and sending of an addPlaces call to a remote directory. Sends multiple keys on the same place with the same cost/quality and description if the description, cost and quality lists are only size 1. Uses a distinct description/cost/quality for each key when there are enough values
      Parameters:
      parentDirectory - the url portion of the parent directory location
      entryList - the list of directory entries to add
      propagating - true if going downstream
      Returns:
      status of operation

    • outboundRemovePlaces

      public EmissaryResponse outboundRemovePlaces(String directory, List<String> key, boolean propagating)
      Handle the packaging and sending of an removePlaces call to a remote directory
      Parameters:
      directory - the url portion of the remote directory location
      key - list of keys to remove (four-tuples)
      propagating - true if doing down stream
      Returns:
      status of operation

    • outboundFailDirectory

      public EmissaryResponse outboundFailDirectory(String directory, String failKey, boolean permanent)
      Handle the packaging and sending of an addPlaces call to a remote directory
      Parameters:
      directory - the url portion of the destination directory
      failKey - key of the directory that failed
      permanent - true from normal deregistration
      Returns:
      status of operation

    • inboundFailDirectory

      public boolean inboundFailDirectory(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
      Process the failDirectory call coming remotely over HTTP request params onto the specified (local) directory place.
      Parameters:
      req - the inbound request object

    • outboundZoneTransfer

      public DirectoryEntryMap outboundZoneTransfer(String key, String myKey) throws EmissaryException
      Request the XML directory entry markup from a remote directory peer and turn the response XML into a Map of String,DirectoryEntryList for return
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the remote directory to request the zone transfer from
      myKey - the key of the local requesting the zone or null if none
      Returns:
      DirectoryEntryList map from the remote side
      Throws:
      EmissaryException - if remote returns an error

    • outboundRegisterPeer

      public DirectoryEntryMap outboundRegisterPeer(String key, String peerKey) throws EmissaryException
      Request the XML directory entry markup from a remote directory peer and turn the response XML into a DirectoryEntryMap for return. Register the caller as a peer of the destination as part of the transfer.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of the remote directory to request the zone transfer from
      peerKey - the key of the peer requesting the zone or null if none
      Returns:
      DirectoryEntryList map from the remote side
      Throws:
      EmissaryException - if remote returns an error
